page.title: 01The hills east of LLwyngwril
page.content: Most of the hills around this area are covered by heath grass and moorland, and although there exists a plantation of conifer trees in the NE section of the region, the land is largely used for sheep farming. A few homesteads survive in this area, but numerically far less than the various standidng stones and Cairn sites that dominate the widswept landscape. The main road and railway-track follows the coastline in the far NW of the section (A493) and numerous footpatchs exist, for the most part, following the many small river valleys that predominate.
